thread.title: Telangana CM pleasing gods! After Tirupati, KCR to offer 'gold moustache' at Kuravi Veerabhadra Swamy Temple | Zee News
thread.title_full: Telangana CM pleasing gods! After Tirupati, KCR to offer 'gold moustache' at Kuravi Veerabhadra Swamy Temple | Zee News

title: Telangana CM pleasing gods! After Tirupati, KCR to offer 'gold moustache' at Kuravi Veerabhadra Swamy Temple | Zee News
text:
Telangana CM pleasing gods! After Tirupati, KCR to offer 'gold moustache' at Kuravi Veerabhadra Swamy Temple By Zee Media Bureau | Last Updated: Friday, February 24, 2017 - 12:10 0 
Hyderabad: Unfazed by his criticism from the Opposition for spending, what many claim to be tax payers money, Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrasekhara Rao is all set to offer a gold moustache at Kuravi Veerabhadra Swamy Temple. 
The gold moustache or 'bangaru meesalu' costs around Rs 75,000. Telangana CM K Chandrasekhara Rao to offer 'bangaru meesalu' (gold moustache) costing around Rs 75,000 at Kuravi Veerabhadra Swamy Temple. pic.twitter.com/20PXfxffde 
â€” ANI (@ANI_news) February 24, 2017 
Earlier, KCR was seen donating gold, reportedly worth crores, at the Venkateswara Swamy Temple, also known as the Tirupati temple. 
Post his flamboyant tribute at the famous hill shrine of Lord Venkateshwara near Tirumala, Congress leader Madhu Yashki Goud said that it was gross misuse of public money and that the Opposition should file a complaint against the Chief Minister. MUST READ Telangana CM KCR to offer 11.7 kg golden crown worth Rs 3.70 cr to Goddess Bhadrakali 
The Chief Minister had pledged ornaments to various gods and goddesses in both Telangana and Andhra Pradesh if his mission succeeded. 
In an installment of his thank-you journeys in October, KCR presented a nearly 12 kg gold crown worth Rs. 3.5 crore to the Goddess Bhadrakali at Warangal. 
The Telangana government commissioned a prominent Hyderabad jeweller to make the crown. 
Earlier, a crown and necklace was presented to Lord Venkateswara in Tirumala and a nose stud to goddess Kanaka Durga in Vijayawada. 
With ANI inputs First Published: Friday, February 24, 2017 - 12:04 More from zeenews
